content.description: This is the crack that splits the Northwest face.  Mostly stemming with good gear.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3". Two bolt anchor at the top.  Larger hexes work well.
content.location: Crack on the Northwest face.   To the right of the bolted line "Coming in Hot".

climbs.name: Crash Landing
climbs.fa: Oct 2021 Gabe & Rachel Skiera, Curtis Baird

content.description: The first 15 feet are the business. Despite the name this route is very safe.
content.location: Line of bolts to the left of "Coming In Hot".

climbs.name: Coming In Hot
climbs.fa: Oct 2021 Gabe & Rachel Skiera, Curtis Baird

content.description: Follow the big holds up a deceptively steep face.
content.location: Line of 5 bolts just to the left of the prominent corner/crack.

content.description: This route starts up hill, around the corner, and to the right of the crack that splits the northwest face.  Climb the edges and nubs to the horizontal/flake on the western edge. Then follow the weakness to the summit.  The route can be decended via a rappel from the top anchors or downclimb via the gully.
content.location: Western edge of the Picnic Pinnacle.

content.description:
This large boulder / needle is right off the main trail. You can accessed the top for setting up top ropes if desired. 

  This rock more than likely has another name associated with it as a few generations of TR anchors can be found on top. If you know anything leave a comment or hit the improve page button.
